title: What causes two air bubbles in water to pull each other? - Quora

response.answer_text: They don’t necessarily in microgravity. If they happen to encounter one another, say one “floats up” faster, the bubbles produce less pressure when combined into one larger one, so it is more stable, releases energy, when they combine into one larger bubble.

I believe as they rise the get electrical charged and the ones that have opposite charges are attracted to each other. Some bubbles combine because the surface tension is not strong enough to repel the electrical forces that are attracting them to each other…. Not a scientist, but based on what I remember about what I was taught!
